title: Hispanic museum close to getting home
subtitle: Hispanic museum close to getting home
body: SAN FRANCISCO -- The anticipation of seeing the Hispanic Heritage Baseball Museum have a real home -- as opposed to being a traveling exhibit -- is akin to watching the late Roberto Clemente step to the plate. Pure baseball fun and excitement. Especially for Gabriel "Tito" Avila, founder, president and CEO of the non-profit museum, who has seen his idea grow from infancy in 1999 through tough financial times as a teenager. But now HHBM is all grown up. Rich Draper is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Rich Draper
